Text.val: Calculation based on an average of already known gross amount
2) Investment payment of which at least the amount is known in regular payout.
If a payment is expected in the year and no gross amount is yet known for the regular payment, the calculation will be based on
the portfolio value in combination with the remaining periods

Comment.val: Task checks whether there is an amount for the first payment of the regular payment type. If it does exist, we can use the average method for the calculation over the entire year.
Task calculates the annual salary of a pay-out series using the average method. This means that an average benefit amount is calculated and the additional amount is calculated for the entire year.

SQL_STMT_U.val: select sum(bbd_bruto_bedrag), bbd_type, count(*) from belaste_betalingen_detail where bbd_opdrachtnummer = ~1 and bbd_opdrachtdatum between ~2 and ~3 and (bbd_status between 1 and 5 or bbd_status=9) and bbd_bruto_bedrag<>0 group by bbd_type

Text.val: We will treat redrmption, lumpsum and accidental payments differently from regular payments. These are one-off payments

Comment.val: If no amount is known for an investment payout for the regular remuneration type, the calculation will base on the portfolio value in combination with the remaining periods to calculate the average and extrapolate it to the entire year.
